paper_abstract: We present a new way of constraining the evolution of a region- based active contour with respect to a reference shape. Minimizing a shape prior, defined as a distance between shape descriptors based on the Legendre moments of the characteristic function, leads to a geometric flow that can be used with benefits in a two- class segmentation application. The shape model includes intrinsic invariance with regard to pose and affine deformations.
paper_title: Affine-invariant geometric shape priors for region-based active contours
